abstract: In a trend known as consumer-generated content, an 18-year-old student and Apple devotee was hired to make a television commercial for Apple’s new iPod Touch.
snippet: In a trend known as consumer-generated content, an 18-year-old student and Apple devotee was hired to make a television commercial for Apple’s new iPod Touch.
lead_paragraph: THE idea that you do not have to be a professional to create a good commercial is becoming widespread, in a trend known as consumer-generated content. Leave it to Apple to  paraphrasing the company’s old slogan a bit  think differently.

headline.main: A Consumer’s Spot for Apple Grows Up
headline.print_headline: A Consumer’s Spot for Apple Grows Up

abstract: Answering questions from Bits readers, Dalton Caldwell, the chief executive of Imeem, explains how the music-oriented social network plans to compete with MySpace, Facebook, and Apple.
snippet: Answering questions from Bits readers, Dalton Caldwell, the chief executive of Imeem, explains how the music-oriented social network plans to compete with MySpace, Facebook, and Apple.
lead_paragraph: Dalton Caldwell, the chief executive of Imeem, a music-oriented social network, and Steve Jang, Imeem’s chief marketing officer and head of business development, agreed to answer questions from Bits readers. Here is the first batch of their answers. If you have more questions, post them  here.

headline.main: Imeem Q&A: Competing in Music Through Community
